page.title: 14Port trade
page.content: Imports into the southern end of the port include fertilizers, woodpulp and oil for the power station, soon to close, and the BP and Shell Mex depots. Exports are of general cargo in particular and associated with the ferries. On average about 20 to 30 ships enter and leave daily, of which perhaps half will be supply boats for the North Sea gas rigs, 3 are roll-on roll-off ferries and the rest cargo boats. The ferries operate especially to Scheveningen and carry Norfolk Line trailers and a few cars and passengers. A small number of inshore fishing boats, mostly undecked, operate in the immediate area catching shrimps and longshore herring. The port tug, Hector Reade also berths within the area of the survey.
